Author: blader
Content: I would too. It was just quick a dirty to do it that way. We'll definitely be changing that very soon.

Author: myoung8
Content: The cost difference is incurred by the race director (or event management firm), though, not the consumer. A $1 difference over 20,000 registrants is a big difference IMHO.

Author: rms
Content:
On the buy page, I would prefer if you don't redirect me to the profile of the pet I just bought. It would be a much faster interface if I could just keep buying. Also, I can buy a pet I already own from the "Steal this pet" button on my profile.

The game itself is oddly compelling, especially for a game where the mechanics haven't quite been sorted out.

Author: myoung8
Content: Usability, cost advantages to reduce price, value-added services, etc.

Author: corentin
Content: Looks more like a letter from Mandriva to its users/shareholders ("look at us, Microsoft is bullying us"). Microsoft couldn't care less.

Author: blader
Title: Our YC Interview Demo - we just launched it
Content: So our team wanted to start on a new app after we got the interview notice, and we decided to launch it today. We'd love to get your feedback on it before PG grills us.

Author: szczupak
Title: Interview with the founder of Killerstartups dot com

Author: myoung8
Content: I'd love to hear what you think the problems with Active are. My email's in my profile.

Author: herdrick
Content:
I think language has a lot to do with it. To do the same thing in Python, Ruby, Scheme or whatever there is just less to think about. This frees up your brain to think about algorithims and little else. C++ is jammed with distractions.

It's not that dynamic languages make a problem super easy, but they do help quite a bit.

Author: rms
Content: Yeah... sometimes, more so than the execution, it's about having money or someone who wants to give you money. If you had 10 million dollars you could start making your own line of "Extreme"  caffeinated breakfast cereals/health foods.

Author: rainsill
Title: 10 Ways To Go Viral

Content: It's not just procrastination. It's marketing.
